DOC.brief_summary: Following brain injury ( e.g . stroke ) , application non-invasive brain stimulation may improve rehabilitative effort . However , effective method non-invasive brain stimulation unknown . Paired associative stimulation ( PAS ) method non-invasive brain stimulation pair electrical peripheral nerve stimulus magnetic stimulus head . This method apply manner increase ( facilitates ) decrease ( depresses ) excitability within brain . Furthermore , apply two consecutive PAS session within minute ( call prim PAS ) may augment change excitability single PAS session alone . Thus , purpose study compare effect double PAS session ( primed PAS ) effect single PAS session ( unprimed PAS ) sham PAS session healthy individual .
DOC.brief_title: Primed v Unprimed Facilitatory Depressive Paired Associative Stimulation
DOC.criteria: ≥ 18 ≤ 30 year age Elicitable motor evoke potential motor cortex contralateral dominant hand Elicitable N20 sensory evoke potential History neurological disease Seizure within past 2 year Currently take epileptogenic medication Peripheral neuropathy Cognitive impairment and/or major psychiatric disorder Metal head ( dental permit ) Pacemaker indwell device Pregnancy
